metadata.title: CVE-2015-2221 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
ClamAV before 0.98.7 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(infinite loop) via a crafted y0da cryptor file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2221` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

clamav - 0.98.7+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-base - 0.98.7+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-daemon - 0.98.7+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-freshclam - 0.98.7+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-milter - 0.98.7+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-testfiles - 0.98.7+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libclamav6 - 0.98.7+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: clamav package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.98.7+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
